Category.Name: All Samples
Category.description: The complete list of sample applications for Map Suite MVC Edition.

Category.Name: MVC Edition vs. Web Edition
Category.description: These samples demonstrate the differences between Map Suite MVC Edition and the traditional Web Edition.

Category.Name: Background Maps (Google, Bing, etc)
Category.description: These samples show how to incorporate third-party background maps into your application.

Sample.Name: Display a Simple Map
Sample.Description: This sample simply shows how to load a ThinkGeo default world map.

Sample.Name: Use Bing Map
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to load a map from Bing's REST service and switch between different map types (road, aerial, hybrid, etc.).

Sample.Name: Load An ArcGISServerRestOverlay
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to load a map from the ESRI ArcGIS REST service. This overlay gives developers a simple and powerful tool to access their maps that reside on ArcGIS Server. This new overlay utilizes the ArcGIS Server REST API at http://resources.esri.com/help/9.3/arcgisserver/apis/rest/.

Sample.Name: Use OpenStreetMap
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to load a map from OpenStreetMap. OpenStreetMap (OSM) is a collaborative project to create free geographic data for the entire world. It can be thought of the "Free Wiki World Map".

Sample.Name: Load a WmsOverlay
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates loading map images from a standards-compliant Web Map Service (WMS). It supports WMS schemas of version 1.1.0, 1.1.1 and 1.3.0.

Category.Name: InteractiveOverlays
Category.description: These samples show various aspects of how to extend or create InteractiveOverlays, which allow you to draw and manipulate shapes, add markers and more.

Sample.Name: Set Image Format and Quality
Sample.Description: This sample simply sets the format and quality of the map images. With these properties, we can reduce the size of each map tile to improve the access speed.

Sample.Name: Set the Background Color
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the map's background color on the fly.

Sample.Name: Add a Marker
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a small marker image on the map to represent a point of interest.

Sample.Name: AutoRefreshOverlay
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to use the AutoRefresh functionality to refresh the map periodically.

Sample.Name: Draw and Edit Shapes
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to use the EditOverlay to draw and edit shapes on the map. The EditOverlay is used to contain the features that you want to edit on the client side. All of the features in this Overlay will be converted to client shapes. Of course, you can pass these shapes to the controller to save them.

Sample.Name: Track Shape Finished Event
Sample.Description: The sample demonstrates the TrackShapeFinished event of the map. If you attach handlers to this event, the map will raise a form-submit each time you finish drawing a shape.

Sample.Name: Change Edit Settings
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates the editing modes supported by Map Suite MVC Edition.

Sample.Name: Label and Rotate a Marker
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to label and rotate a marker at runtime.

Sample.Name: Click Event on a Marker
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates the click event on a marker. If you click on the marker, it will raise a form-submit and pass the available information to an action in the controller.

Sample.Name: Highlight a Feature While Hovering
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to select and highlight a feature specified by hovering over it with your mouse.

Sample.Name: Add a Click Event to a HighlightOverlay
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates the use of the click ServerEvent of the HighlightOverlay.

Sample.Name: Add a Context Menu to a HighlightOverlay
Sample.Description: This samples demonstrates adding a context menu on a HighlightOverlay. If you right-click on a feature contained in the overlay, the context menu will show up; otherwise, nothing will happen.

Sample.Name: Union Two Features
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to perform Union geoprocessing on two features.

Sample.Name: Find the Differences Between Two Features
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to find the differences between two specified features.

Sample.Name: Shortest Line Between Features
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to calculate the shortest line between features.

Sample.Name: Buffer a Feature
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to buffer a feature and then display it on the map.

Sample.Name: Area of a Feature
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to calculate the area of a feature.

Sample.Name: Length of a Feature
Sample.Description: This samples shows how to calculate the length of a feature.

Sample.Name: Envelope of a Feature
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to get the envelope of a feature. The envelope is a rectangle that encompasses all of the feature's geometry.

Category.Name: Labeling
Category.description: These samples show various ways to use labeling in your application.

Sample.Name: Label Nice Looking Roads
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to draw and label a series of roads using a visually pleasing style.

Sample.Name: Label Points of Interest
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to draw and label a layer of cities with a predefined style.

Sample.Name: Change Point Label Placement
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the position of the labels for point-based features.

Sample.Name: Label Water Features
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to draw and label a layer of lakes and other water features, using a visually pleasing style.

Sample.Name: Draw Curved Labels
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to render labels that follow the contours of curved streets or other line-based features.

Category.Name: Layers & FeatureSources
Category.description: These samples demonstrate custom layers and feature sources, which you can use as inspiration for integrating your own custom types of data.

Sample.Name: Plot a Point Using Lat and Long
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to draw a point on the map at the specified coordinates by using a custom image.

Sample.Name: Create a ScaleLineAdormentLayer
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to display a scale line on the map using ScaleLineAdornmentLayer.

Sample.Name: Create a RestrictionLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to render the map at a limited extent or prevent certain areas from displaying.

Sample.Name: Create a GraticuleAdornmentLayer
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates adding a graticule layer to the map to display a grid of latitude and longitude values.

Sample.Name: Load TabFileFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from a MapInfo TAB file.

Sample.Name: Create an InMemoryFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data that is stored only in memory.

Sample.Name: Create a Spatial Index for a ShapeFileFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to create a spatial index for a ShapeFileFeatureLayer.

Sample.Name: Load a GridFileFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from a Grid file.

Sample.Name: Load a Map from Streams
Sample.Description: As an alternative to loading data from a specified data source on the file system, you can choose to pass your own stream. This sample shows you how to use the StreamLoading event of the ShapeFileFeatureSource for this purpose.

Sample.Name: Load a MSSQL2008FeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from Microsoft SQL Server 2008.

Sample.Name: Load a OracleFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from an Oracle Spatial database.

Sample.Name: Load a PostgreSQLFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from PostgreSQL PostGIS.

Sample.Name: Load a ShapeFileFeatureLayer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a map using data loaded from a ShapeFile (.shp).

Sample.Name: Load A HeatLayer
Sample.Description:
Heat maps are a technique increasingly used in various fields such as biology and geology. They are also used for displaying areas of web pages that are most frequently interacted with.

In this sample, we apply this concept to geographic maps. Heat maps are a great way to give users a visually compelling representation of the distribution and intensity of geographic phenomena.

Sample.Name: Display a Satellite Image
Sample.Description: This sample simply adds an ECW layer to show a satellite image on the map.

Sample.Name: Load a Standard Image with World File
Sample.Description: A "standard image" is one of several formats supported natively by the Windows operating system; these include .bmp, .png, .gif and so on. In this sample we'll show you how to load these types of images onto a map with just a few lines of code.

Sample.Name: Using Custom Data
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to add your own data to a ShapeFile feature layer.

Sample.Name: Display Layers at Different Scales
Sample.Description:
In this sample, we show you how to set different styles for the map or load different data to the map at scales from 1:10,000 to 1:100,000,000.

This sample is also an opportunity to review the very basic concept of scale in GIS. The easiest way to think about scale is to consider it a ratio between what you see on the screen and the real world. So, if the scale is 1:10,000 it basically means that one centimeter (you can use any unit) on the screen represents 10,000 centimeters (or 100 meters) in the real world. Of course, there are some intricacies involved with calculating the scale for a map according to its projection, etc. But if you think of scale in that very simple way, you will have a general idea of what your map's scale truly represents.

Sample.Name: Prevent Certain Features from Drawing
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to apply a filter to your data before rendering.

Sample.Name: Convert To/From Well Known Binary
Sample.Description: This sample shows you how to convert a geographic shape to WKB (Well Known Binary) and back.

Sample.Name: Convert To/From Well Known Text
Sample.Description: This sample shows you how to convert a geographic shape to WKT (Well Known Text) and back.

Category.Name: Miscellaneous
Category.description: These samples demonstrate a variety of miscellaneous features of Map Suite MVC Edition.

Sample.Name: Change Loading Image
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to customize the loading image that appears when zooming in/out on the map.

Sample.Name: Add a Context Menu
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a context menu when you right-click on the map.

Sample.Name: Add a Popup
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to display a pop-up information bubble on the map.

Sample.Name: Using a Mini-Map
Sample.Description: This sample enables a small mini-map that pans/interacts together with your main map.

Sample.Name: Wrap Dateline
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to work around dateline issues by wrapping the dateline on a number of layer types.

Sample.Name: Marker with Context Menu
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to add a context menus that appears when right-clicking a marker, which allows us to perform various actions.

Sample.Name: ZoomLevels on Markers
Sample.Description: Just like the sample "Display Layers at Different Scales", this sample shows how to set different marker styles and attached popup information when the map is zoomed to different magnification levels.

Sample.Name: Draggable Markers
Sample.Description: In this sample, we show how to place markers which can then be dragged to move them to a new location.

Sample.Name: BaseOverlayChanged Event
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to raise the BaseOverlayChanged event when you switch the base overlay of the map using the Overlay Switcher controls (or any other method).

Sample.Name: OnOverlayDrawing Client Event
Sample.Description: In this sample, we show you how to reset the GoogleOverlay's PanZoomBar by using the client-side "OnOverlaysDrawing" event.

Sample.Name: Add Additional Custom Properties and Methods
Sample.Description: This sample shows how you can add additional custom properties and methods to your objects.

Sample.Name: Use PDF Extension
Sample.Description: In this sample, we show you how to use the PdfGeoCanvas in PdfExtension to print a typical map as a PDF document.

Sample.Name: Find World Coordinates Where the User Clicked
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to get the coordinates (in world system) at the point where the user clicked.

Sample.Name: Convert World Coordinates to Screen
Sample.Description: This sample shows you how to convert a coordinate in the world system to a drawing coordinate on the screen.

Sample.Name: Convert Screen Coordinates to World
Sample.Description: This sample shows you how to convert a drawing coordinate on the screen to a coordinate in the world system.

Sample.Name: Get Distance Between Two Points
Sample.Description: This sample simply shows you how to get the distance between two points.

Category.Name: Printing
Category.description: These samples demonstrate robust printing and page layout features.

Sample.Name: Print a Map
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates the robust controls available for creating a page layout and printing the map to it.

Category.Name: Projection
Category.description: These sample features various usages of projections.

Sample.Name: Use a Different Projection for a Feature Layer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to convert a single layer's projection from EPSG:4326 to EPSG:2163.

Sample.Name: Use RotationProjection for a Feature Layer
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to project a layer from its own internal projection to an external projection while doing a rotation at the same time.

Category.Name: Spatial Functions
Category.description: These samples demonstrate various spatial functions such as union, buffer, merge, etc.

Sample.Name: Find the Feature the User Clicked
Sample.Description: This sample show you how to find the feature at the point where the user clicked.

Sample.Name: Zoom In to the Feature the User Clicked
Sample.Description: This sample is similar to the sample "Find The Feature The User Clicked On". Here, instead of just showing information about the selected feature, we will instead highlight the feature and the extent of the map will be set to the bounding box of that feature. Just click on a country and the map will zoom in to it.

Sample.Name: Measure Map Tool
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates the Measure map tool, which is used to measure distances and areas.

Sample.Name: Execute a Spatial Query
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to perform various types of geoprocessing in order to query the features in a ShapeFileFeatureSource.

Sample.Name: Find Features Within a Distance
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates finding the features in a ShapeFileFeatureSource that are within a specified distance.

Sample.Name: Get the Feature Count
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to determine the number of features in a feature layer.

Sample.Name: Get All Features
Sample.Description: This sample simply retrieves all the features from a feature layer and displays some of their data.

Sample.Name: Get Column Data
Sample.Description: This sample simply shows how to get all the column data from a feature layer and display them.

Sample.Name: Get Data of the Location Where the User Clicked
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to perform a spatial query and display resulting information about the area we clicked on.

Sample.Name: Find Feature by ID
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to find and display detailed information about a feature based on its ID.

Sample.Name: Draw the Map Using Different Simplification Types
Sample.Description: The sample shows how to render the map geometry using two different simplification types (TopologyPeserving or DouglasPeucker).

Category.Name: Styles
Category.description: These samples show various kinds of styles that can be applied to features, including custom symbols, colors, and data-driven styles.

Sample.Name: Draw using FleeBooleanStyle
Sample.Description: The sample shows how to style a map using the FleeBooleanStyle. In this example, the hightlighted features are the landlocked countries whose population is greater than 10 million.

Sample.Name: Using Predefined Styles
Sample.Description: Map Suite MVC Edition includes numerous built-in styles like these, which allow you easily set up a visually appealing map.

Sample.Name: Draw a Point Using a Bitmap
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to mark a point on the map using a custom bitmap image.

Sample.Name: Draw a Point Using a Symbol
Sample.Description: This samples shows how to mark a point on the map using a symbol.

Sample.Name: Draw Features Based on a Value
Sample.Description: This sample renders cities in different styles based on their "POP_RANK" data value.

Sample.Name: Change the Fill and Outline Colors
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to change the fill and outline colors of a polygon at runtime.

Sample.Name: Change the Width and Color of a Line
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to change the width and color of a line at runtime.

Sample.Name: Convert GeoColor to/from OLE, Win32, HTML, or ARGB Colors
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to convert GeoColor to and from OLE, Win32, HTML, or ARGB colors.

Sample.Name: Get a Group of Colors in the Same Quality (Hue) Family
Sample.Description: In this sample, we use a group of colors in the same family of red (but with different strengths) to draw five different countries.

Sample.Name: Draw using ZedGraphStyle
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to add pie graphs to the map using the ZedGraph library.

Sample.Name: Dot Density Drawing Using Numerical Data
Sample.Description: This sample uses a different density of dots to represent different populations of U.S. states.

Sample.Name: Draw Features Based on a Regular Expression
Sample.Description: In this sample, we use a regular expression to draw countries that have the string "land" in their name (such as Greenland) using a distinct style.

Sample.Name: Draw Thematic Features
Sample.Description: In this sample, we have broken down the population of each country into ranges and then used different colors to represent the ranges.

Sample.Name: Using Geographic, Simple and Standard Colors
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to change the border and fill colors by using built-in styles.

Category.Name: Vehicle Tracking
Category.description: These samples show various features related to vehicle and asset tracking.

Sample.Name: Vehicle Tracking
Sample.Description: In this sample, we create a simple vehicle tracking demo to show how to interact between the client and the server action in a controller. All of the functionalities are based on AJAX technology, which will greatly improve the user experience.

Category.Name: Zooming, Panning, Moving
Category.description: These samples show various ways to move the map around.

Sample.Name: Zoom In and Out
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to zoom the map in or out.

Sample.Name: Navigation History
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to zoom back and forth between previously used map extents.

Sample.Name: Track Zoom in a Map
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to track zoom the map to a specified extent defined by dragging the mouse.

Sample.Name: Pan the Map
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to enable/disable the functionality which allows the user to pan the map or use the mouse wheel to zoom in or out.

Sample.Name: Control the Map Via Keyboard
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to manipulate the map using the keyboard.

Sample.Name: Restrict ZoomLevels to Less than 20
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to limit the number of available ZoomLevels to less than 20.

Sample.Name: ExtentChanged Event
Sample.Description: This sample reports the updated scale and extent as you pan or zoom the map.

Sample.Name: AnimationPanMapTool
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to center the map at the clicked point using a smooth animation.

Sample.Name: Move a Feature
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to move a feature drawn in the InMemoryFeatureLayer.

Sample.Name: Scale Feature Up and Down
Sample.Description: This sample shows how to change the size of a polygon by scaling it up or down.

Category.Name: Interactive Map
Category.description: These samples show various aspects of how to interact with map using JavaScript.

Sample.Name: Change Cursor Style
Sample.Description: In this MVC-based sample, we show how to change the cursor style when moving the mouse on the map.

Sample.Name: Add a Click Event
Sample.Description: This sample demonstrates how to raise the click event on the map.

Sample.Name: Interact With Map
Sample.Description: In this web-based project, we show you how to do a two-way interaction between the features in an InMemoryFeatureLayer and their information in GridView.
